title.native: 無彩限のファントム・ワールド

description:
The story takes place in the near future, in a world born of human imagination. What humans would call ghosts or monsters appear, and they come to be called "phantoms". The main character, Haruhiko Ichijo, is a first year at Hosea Academy along with his upperclassman Mai Kawakami, who fights phantoms with the ability "Spirit of Five Elements", Izumi Reina, who has the ability "Phantom Eater", and Koito Minase, who fights phantoms in solitude. They experience the ups and downs of high school life before a certain incident leads them to the truth of this world.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kannrininnsan)

**Residency:** Kawaguchi, Saitama Prefecture, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shirabii) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/216403)

A prominent director and a key member of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).

After graduating from Osaka Designers' College in the late '80s, Ishihara joined Kyoto Animation and began his career as an animator. In 1991, he made his debut as a director with [Shiawasette Naani](https://anilist.co/anime/13441/). After that, he switched his focus to directing. Back then Kyoto Animation was still a sub-contracting studio, so therefore Ishihara could only get a handful of opportunities directing. Some of the shows in which Ishihara got to direct multiple episodes were [Tenchi Muyou!](https://anilist.co/anime/696/), [Aka-chan to Boku](https://anilist.co/anime/1485/), [Hyper Police](https://anilist.co/anime/1180/), and [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/). He also storyboarded the majority of the episodes he directed.

In 2003, Kyoto Animation started their transformation into a full-fledged animation studio producing their first anime series, [Fullmetal Panic? Fumoffu](https://anilist.co/anime/72/). Ishihara directed and storyboarded the 7th episode of the show. Two years later in 2005, he made his proper directorial debut directing the studio's second TV show, [Air](https://anilist.co/anime/101/). The following year he directed the award winning anime series, [The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/). From here Ishihara has gone on to direct multiple of Kyoto Animation's acclaimed works.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田和美)

Kazumi Ikeda is a Japanese animator and character designer currently affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). She joined KyoAni in 1995 after graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and transferred to the studio's Osaka branch [Animation Do](https://anilist.co/studio/929/Animation-Do) when it was established in 2000.

She is best known for doing the character designs in KyoAni's anime adaptations of Key's most prominent visual novels, [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/1530/Kanon-2006/) and [Clannad](https://anilist.co/anime/2167/Clannad/), marking also her debut as chief animation director on the Kanon remake.

She has no blood relationship with late [Shouko Ikeda](https://anilist.co/staff/102736/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田和美)

Kazumi Ikeda is a Japanese animator and character designer currently affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). She joined KyoAni in 1995 after graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and transferred to the studio's Osaka branch [Animation Do](https://anilist.co/studio/929/Animation-Do) when it was established in 2000.

She is best known for doing the character designs in KyoAni's anime adaptations of Key's most prominent visual novels, [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/1530/Kanon-2006/) and [Clannad](https://anilist.co/anime/2167/Clannad/), marking also her debut as chief animation director on the Kanon remake.

She has no blood relationship with late [Shouko Ikeda](https://anilist.co/staff/102736/).

SCREEN mode is a unit formed by sound producer Masatomo Ohta and voice actor Yuu Hayashi.

[Website](http://screenmode.net/)

[Profile](www.horipro-international.com/artist/musician/tadokoro) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/azusa-tadokoro) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AzusaTadokoro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/azusa_tadokoro/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tadokoroazusaofficial)

She was a member in the tennis club at her middle and high schools, and she was also the general manager of the club in high school. When Azusa was in 8th grade, she was inspired to become a voice actress after hearing the Akiko Yajima's performance as Kohaku in Inuyasha. She participated in Horipro's 36th Talent Scout Caravan on October 11, 2011, was awarded as the grand prix winner and made her debut as a voice actress in 2012. In 2014, she made her official debut as a singer with the album "Beyond Myself!".

Azusa's hobbies including karaoke, impersonating, making albums, cooking and sewing. Her special skills include tennis - which she has been playing ever since fifth grade of elementary school - and arm wrestling, and she likes to stay healthy. She also loves both cows and movies, and has said that her ideal date would be either tennis or a movie so that she wouldn’t have to talk a lot. Azusa has four older brothers, and she went to the same high school as [Megumi Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/96105/Megumi-Nakajima)

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

Mikiko Watanabe was a background artist and art director affiliated with Kyoto Animation.

She tragically lost her life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.

She tragically lost her life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.

Youko Kogawa is a Japanese producer and planner working at Pony Canyon.

__Aliases:__ ポッキー (Pocky), 社長 (President)

__Shunji Inoue__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger, producer and animation planner. He founded the music publishing company Lantis in 1999 and became its president.
Began as a painter at Mushi Production then left and established Kyoto Animation with her husband [Hideaki Hatta](https://anilist.co/staff/107789/Hideaki-Hatta).
**Okinaka Susumu (沖中進)** is a Japanese producer and planner
**Masayuki Nishide** is a Japanese producer and animation planner, who works for the Asahi Broadcasting Corporation (ABC).
Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).
